answers.answer: "I am going for a MRI and spec scan to see how my blood flows."The noninvasive test to check blood flow is reactive hyperemia peripheral arterial tonometry (RH-PAT). The MRI is of the abdomen possibly to look for enlarged organs? A SPECT scan [single-photon emission computerized tomography] lets the doctor know how blood flows to your heart and areas of your brain.There's serious health issues going on for these to be ordered, something you need to discuss with your doctor in-depth. Good luck
